name: places/ChIJq-Q3Gv1ZwokRf24mHnkwiTY
formattedAddress: 235 Freedom Pl S, New York, NY 10069, USA
adrFormatAddress: 235 Freedom Pl S, New York, NY 10069, USA

originalText.text:
From the moment you walk in until you walk out you are greeted with respect and very kind, professional staff. Great service! I had the beef Milanese and it was 10/5! Melted in my mouth… Cocktails were great too, especially their own twist on Aperol spritz. You cant leave this place without trying their tiramisu and lemon flourless cake (both so good my phone couldn't even catch a glimpse of it lol). Excellent food, great cocktails and amazing service!
You really can’t miss on this location…

originalText.text:
I’ve seen mixed reviews for Bellini; however, my experience was tremendous. I went for a Sunday brunch, and my whole family enjoyed the food and service.

The atmosphere: is new but still has notes of a classic Italian restaurant. The bar is very well-designed, and the booths are comfortable.

The service: was really good. I had seen some mixed reviews about their service, but it seems they have cleaned those up. Our waiter was very personable and was fun to chat with.

The food: was delicious and fresh. The special risotto was so delicious, and the eggs Benedict received strong reviews from my party. For dessert, the chocolate moose is a must, they make it fresh per order, and it’s a significant portion.

Cleanliness: as expected, everything was clean .

originalText.text: Absolutely wonderful experience!! Restaurant was quiet, ambience was perfect,  well lit, and honestly great restaurant all around. (Btw the salads were very dressed despite the pictures.) Will return!

text.text: Absolutely wonderful experience!! Restaurant was quiet, ambience was perfect,  well lit, and honestly great restaurant all around. (Btw the salads were very dressed despite the pictures.) Will return!

originalText.text: Service has been consistent and food is always good but always keep thinking it would be amazing. Even the truffle pasta was a bit less than would expect for the price range. We have been here a few times and likely will come back but maybe with lower expectations.

text.text: Service has been consistent and food is always good but always keep thinking it would be amazing. Even the truffle pasta was a bit less than would expect for the price range. We have been here a few times and likely will come back but maybe with lower expectations.

originalText.text:
I We went for a Sunday brunch. I was torn between 3 and 4 stars. The servers tried their best. There were 3 of us. The food ranged from too complicated, ok and good.
My fish sandwich was just a fish sandwich. Nothing special. The fries were tasteless. My sister’s avocado toast, salmon and egg were, again, ok and probably wouldn’t order it again. My friend’s avocado toast was considered good.  I will say the faro salad was excellent.
Prices were ok if you stay away from the dessert menu and the ridiculous $23 gelato.
I will try it once more for dinner. I will tell you that I love Harry’s Table in general. Hoping Bellini’s continues to improve.
